title: How to prevent duplicate CIs from being created in Service Management
content:
In UCMDB, each federated CI type (such as BusinessService, InfrastructureService, BusinessApplication, and Node) comes with default identification rules to prevent the duplication of key attributes (e.g., name) among different CIs. However, by default, Service Management doesn't have this restriction when creating new CIs, this may cause potential conflicts when data is synchronized with UCMDB through Native SACM.

Although UCMDB eventually rejects such creations and flags errors for duplicated CIs, it's preferable to proactively validate and prevent such duplicates on the Service Management side. To achieve this, you can configure a validation business rule in Studio. For example, to ensure that no duplicated Actual Service with the same display label is created, you can add a validation rule within the "After Change" event, as shown below.Â

Similar validation rules can be defined for other record types such as Service Components and Devices.

No validation rules are needed for System Elements as they can't be created on the Service Management side when Native SACM is enabled.
